members.text: Censorship is wrong in principle. In a free and civilized society, everyone must be free to express herself.
members.title: Argument from Freedom of Speech

pcs.text: Censorship violates freedom of speech.
pcs.title: Untitled 1

pcs.text: Whatever violates an absolute right, is itself wrong in principle.
pcs.title: Untitled 2

pcs.text: Censorship is wrong in principle.
pcs.title: Untitled 3

pcs.text: Censorship violates freedom of speech.
pcs.title: Untitled 1

pcs.text: Whatever violates an absolute right, is itself wrong in principle.
pcs.title: Untitled 2

pcs.text: Censorship is wrong in principle.
pcs.title: Untitled 3

members.text: Freedom of speech ceases to be a right when it causes harm to others. Therefore freedom of speech is never an absolute right but an aspiration.
members.title: No-Harm trumps Freedom-of-Speech

pcs.text: Sometimes, free speech causes serious harms to others.
pcs.title: Untitled 4

pcs.text: Whatever causes serious harms to others is not permissible.
pcs.title: Untitled 5

pcs.text: If freedom of speech is sometimes not permissible, then freedom of speech is not an absolute right.
pcs.title: Untitled 6

pcs.text: Freedom of speech is not an absolute right.
pcs.title: Untitled 7

pcs.text: Sometimes, free speech causes serious harms to others.
pcs.title: Untitled 4

pcs.text: Whatever causes serious harms to others is not permissible.
pcs.title: Untitled 5

pcs.text: If freedom of speech is sometimes not permissible, then freedom of speech is not an absolute right.
pcs.title: Untitled 6

pcs.text: Freedom of speech is not an absolute right.
pcs.title: Untitled 7

members.text: Legislation against incitement to racial hatred is permissible. Thus, censorship is not wrong in principle.
members.title: Argument from racial hatred

pcs.title: IRC-legislation
pcs.text: Legislation against incitement to racial hatred is permissible.
Legislation against incitement to racial hatred is a form of censorship.
pcs.title: Untitled 8
IRC-legislation
pcs.text: Legislation against incitement to racial hatred is permissible.
Legislation against incitement to racial hatred is a form of censorship.
pcs.title: Untitled 8

members.text: Legislation against incitement to racial hatred drives racists and others underground rather than drawing them into open and rational debate.
members.title: Importance of inclusive public debate

pcs.text: We will only have an open, maximally-inclusive and rational societal debate, if racists are not driven underground.
pcs.title: Untitled 9

pcs.text: If legislation against incitement to racial hatred is enacted, racists and others are driven underground.
pcs.title: Untitled 10

pcs.text: We will only have an open, maximally-inclusive and rational societal debate, if legislation against incitement to racial hatred is not enacted.
pcs.title: Untitled 11

pcs.text: We ought to have an open, maximally-inclusive and rational societal debate.
pcs.title: Untitled 12

pcs.text: Legislation against incitement to racial hatred ought not be enacted.
pcs.title: Untitled 13

pcs.text: We will only have an open, maximally-inclusive and rational societal debate, if racists are not driven underground.
pcs.title: Untitled 9

pcs.text: If legislation against incitement to racial hatred is enacted, racists and others are driven underground.
pcs.title: Untitled 10

pcs.text: We will only have an open, maximally-inclusive and rational societal debate, if legislation against incitement to racial hatred is not enacted.
pcs.title: Untitled 11

pcs.text: We ought to have an open, maximally-inclusive and rational societal debate.
pcs.title: Untitled 12

pcs.text: Legislation against incitement to racial hatred ought not be enacted.
pcs.title: Untitled 13

members.text: Excessive sex and violence in film and television contribute to a tendency towards similar behaviour in spectators. In these cases, censorship is obligatory.
members.title: Excessive sex and violence

pcs.title: Causal link
pcs.text: Excessive sex and violence in film and television contributes to a tendency towards similar behaviour in spectators.
Whatever contributes to an tendency towards criminal behaviour may be legally banned, except more weighty reasons speak against doing so.
pcs.title: Untitled 14

pcs.text: There are no substantial reasons against legally banning excessive sex and violence in film and television.
pcs.title: Untitled 15

pcs.text: Excessive sex and violence in film and television may be legally banned.
pcs.title: Untitled 16

pcs.text: If excessive sex and violence in film and television may be legally banned, censorship is not wrong in principle.
pcs.title: Untitled 17
Causal link
pcs.text: Excessive sex and violence in film and television contributes to a tendency towards similar behaviour in spectators.
Whatever contributes to an tendency towards criminal behaviour may be legally banned, except more weighty reasons speak against doing so.
pcs.title: Untitled 14

pcs.text: There are no substantial reasons against legally banning excessive sex and violence in film and television.
pcs.title: Untitled 15

pcs.text: Excessive sex and violence in film and television may be legally banned.
pcs.title: Untitled 16

pcs.text: If excessive sex and violence in film and television may be legally banned, censorship is not wrong in principle.
pcs.title: Untitled 17

members.text: Scientific studies have established a causal link between violence in film and a similar behaviour in spectators.
members.title: Argument from expertise

pcs.text: Scientific studies have established that excessive sex and violence in film and television contributes to a tendency towards similar behaviour in spectators (@[Causal link]).
pcs.title: Untitled 18

pcs.text: If scientific studies have established that X and if there is no evidence against X being the case, then X.
pcs.title: Untitled 19

pcs.text: Scientific studies have established that excessive sex and violence in film and television contributes to a tendency towards similar behaviour in spectators (@[Causal link]).
pcs.title: Untitled 18

pcs.text: If scientific studies have established that X and if there is no evidence against X being the case, then X.
pcs.title: Untitled 19

members.text: The link between sex and violence on screen and in real life is far from conclusive. The individual's personality make her watch violent videos, not vice versa.
members.title: Causal link questionable

pcs.text: The consumption of violent video is correlated with violent and criminal behaviour.
pcs.title: Untitled 20

pcs.text: The best explanation for this correlation is that those individuals who already have tendencies to violence are likely to watch violent `video nasties', just as those with a predilection for rape are likely to use pornography.
pcs.title: Untitled 21

pcs.text: A disposition for criminal behaviour causes the consumption of violent video.
pcs.title: Untitled 22

pcs.text: Causal relations are asymmetric.
pcs.title: Untitled 23

pcs.text: The consumption of violent video does not bring about a disposition for criminal behaviour.
pcs.title: Untitled 24
